ygData.subject: Re: From the diary of a warrior princess
ygData.msgSnippet: I never leave a corpse out over night - just because!  Only once have I had to do that with my bard char and the evil gnoll who caused that painfull death and
ygData.messageBody:
I never leave a corpse out over night - just because! Only once have I had
to do that with my bard char and the evil gnoll who caused that painfull
death and the 6 that followed in unsuccessful retrieval attempts. It was
the named dark gnoll dude from SplitPaw - and someday he will pay and pay
dearly!

Snyak

-----Original Message-----
From: Jones, Brian [mailto:brian.jones@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 03, 1999 9:54 AM
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] From the diary of a
warrior princess

From: "Jones, Brian" <brian.jones@...>

Interesting day you had Patty. Sorry it ended in such
agony. I do
have a suggestion however....I try to make it a point to
never log out
for the night without getting my corpse. I have heard too
many
horror stories of people that came back for their corpse and
it wasn't
there anymore (the Xegony crash comes to mind, don't know
how
corpses are handled when the server crashes but I really
wouldn't
want to chance it).

Angarth, Warrior of the 15th Tier
"Periissem ni periisem"


> ----------
> From: Patricia Halas[SMTP:patty_halas@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Thursday, June 03, 1999 9:44 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: [warriors_eq] From the diary of a warrior
princess
>
> From: Patricia Halas <patty_halas@...>
>
> Got up this morning camped just outside of the entrance to
Guk. As I was
> putting my stuff away I was think about the good times I
has with my guild
>
> mates hunting frogs in the dungeon. I had never been to
Guk and it was a
> lot of fun. Well mostly fun, that one train that wiped
out the entire
> party
> was no fun, especially the walk back from the high pass.
>
> So now I was along in the swamps and backing my stuff.
Darn backpacks
> were
> heavy and as I put them all one I realized I was
encumbered now the
> "Spirit
> of the Bear" had left me (141/130). Time to go sell.
Maybe there is a
> spot
> in South Ro I could sell, if not there I knew I could sell
at the inn in
> Oasis. Oasis would be good. There I could get some
experience killing
> crocodiles and caimans.
>
> So adjusting my backpacks I started off running around the
side of the
> swamp
> to the pass leading to South Ro. An easy trot saw a
couple of frogs and
> an
> alligator or two, but nothing that looked worth hunting.
>
> Once I zoned to South Ro I decided to look around a bit to
see what was
> around. Just a bunch of Orcs, had to kill a couple just
because, but
> didn't
> get any experience. It was also kind of fun to walk
straight through the
> Orc camps since they were too scared of me to do anything.
>
> "Well enough of this" I thought and turned to go into the
desert. Time to
>
> sell my loot and get to killing crocodiles.
>
> As I was crossing the desert I came across a couple of
Troll and a dark
> elf
> killing dervishes. Stopped to check things out for a
second and to see
> what
> the camp looked like. As I was checking things out I saw
a skeleton
> standing out in front of the tents all by himself. Well,
figured I would
> get closer and check him out, might be some good
experience for me on the
> way to Oasis. Big mistake, wasn't just any skeleton but a
dry bone
> skeleton
> that didn't like barbarians.
>
> The trolls jumped in to help me, but even with my dual
long swords flying
> and the trolls beating on the skeleton, I soon found
myself laying on my
> back again wondering why I ever got so close to the
skeleton.
>
> Well soon after that I found myself back in the high hold
pass naked
> except
> for my kilt. As I was standing up I got a message from
Rallos Zek, the
> once
> I was hoping not to here - "You have failed me once again
young barbarian,
>
> no longer can you claim the 16th Rank of warrior, you have
lost a level
> and
> are now 15 again."
>
> Drat and darn, not only did I lose a level, had a long
walk ahead of me,
> but
> all my spare stuff from the bank vault was on my body. Oh
well, back to
> the
> battle, now I really had to go back to Oasis as soon as
possible to make
> 16th Rank again. Pissing off Rallos Zek is never a good
idea.
>
> So I ran as fast as I can, past ghouls, giant spiders,
sand giants and
> orcs.
> Finally I was back in the desert of South Ro, hugging
the wall, and
> looking for my body.
>
> Running south to the dervish tents, I suddenly heard the
sound no one
> wants
> to hear. Even the bravest warrior blanches in fear when
she hears the
> pounding footsteps of a giant behind her.
>
> A sand giant hits you for 96 points
> A sand giant hits you for 87 points
> You are stunned...
>
> Well that hurt. Once I found myself back in the Pass I
decided that was
> enough for the day. Looking around I found myself a nice
flat rock to
> rest
> on and lay down to camp. Good thing I am a barbarian and
the chill air
> this
> high didn't bother me. Guess I will go get my body later
tonight.
>
> For the Honor and Glory of Rallos Zek;
>
> Patty of Halas
> username: Patricia
> server: Bristlebane
>
>
>
